data.name: Crunchy Sine Amplifier
data.description:
You're the king of bass and like the deep sine waves. Back at work, you don't want to miss the waves and write yourself a "crunchy sine amplifier" ๐
Finished programming, you fall in love with the great ASCII art waves on your C64 monitor.

What to expect? `printSine(60, 5)` will print one period of the sine wave in this form:
```

```

#### Some hints:
* `width` defines the number of chars used to stretch one period of the sine wave.
* The `amp` value defines the number of chars up and down from the baseline - seen as a multiplier.
* Be careful! Only one y-value is allowed per x-value โ there might be "empty" rows.
* `width` less than or equal to `0` will generate an empty string.
* `amp` less than `0` will generate an empty string, too.
* Use default methods for rounding and sine (e.g. in Java: Math.round(), Math.sin()).

Good luck! ๐
